subject: More Understanding
body:
Dear Friend,

Thanks for getting back to me. Let me throw more light to this deal. This is a legitimate transaction that has to do with understanding and the union bank of Nigeria plc is where my late client Mr. Steve Moore deposited the $15 million dollars before his death. At this juncture my dear friend I want us to strike this transaction together and I sensed that you are a responsible and trustworthy person who can handle this transaction with all maturity of purpose and as a Legal luminary with 18 years of experience, I know the Law and will use my Legal Expertise to make sure that everything goes well.

Only what I need from you is your acceptance to assist me with this transaction that is of great benefit to both of us to achieve our goal in life. Once you accept to assist me and send the needed personal information, I will proceed to the union bank of Nigeria plc to submit your data as the next of kin /beneficiary to the $15 million dollars. I will want you to reconfirm the following information's below :-

1. Your Full Name

2. Residence Address

3. Telephone/Fax Number

4. Occupation

5. Date of Birth.

With this listed information I will proceed to the Bank and submit your data to the Bank as the Next of Kin to my late Client.

Regards.
Barrister Edward Ikechi

subject: Re: More Understanding
body:
Hello Barrister Edward Ikechi,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's quite an intriguing situation, isn't it? I must admit, I'm not very familiar with these types of transactions. Could you perhaps explain a bit more about how this process works? 

Also, I'm curious about Mr. Steve Moore. What kind of person was he? How did he come to have such a large sum of money in the Union Bank of Nigeria?

I appreciate your trust in me and your belief that I can handle this with maturity. However, before we proceed further, could you please provide some sort of proof or documentation regarding this deposit? Just to make sure everything is above board.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Keith

subject: Re: More Understanding
body:
Hello Barrister Edward Ikechi,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's quite an intriguing situation, isn't it? I must admit, I'm not very familiar with these types of transactions. Could you perhaps explain a bit more about how this process works? 

Also, I'm curious about Mr. Steve Moore. What kind of person was he? How did he come to have such a large sum of money in the Union Bank of Nigeria?

I'm sorry for all the questions, but as you can probably tell, I'm not very experienced in these matters and want to make sure I understand everything correctly.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Keith

subject: More understanding
body:
Dear

I will start by telling you that this transaction is legal and ;egitinate which has legal backing and as my profession as a lawyer, I know hat it takes to make such transaction a sucessful one. All I need is for us to join hands together to work as a team and we will achive this opportunity that is waiting for us. Again, Mr steve Moore happens to be a contractor (enginer) with the shell petrolum company here in Nigeria, with numerious contract which he executed he was able to have saved such an amount of money ($15 million dollars) before his death. However, when this transaction is completed and the $15 million dollars transfer to any of your nominated bank account, then I will arrange for my travelling documents to come to your country for my own sgear of the $15 million dollars. You will have 60%, 35% for me and 5% will be mapped for the expenses. Attached document is the fund deposit certificate of my late client. I will proceed to the union bank of Nigeria plc to submit your data as the next of kin /beneficiary to the $15 million dollars. I will want you to reconfirm the following information's below :-

1. Your Full Name

2. Residence Address

3. Telephone/Fax Number

4. Occupation

5. Date of Birth.

With this listed information I will proceed to the Bank and submit your data to the Bank as the Next of Kin to my late Client.

Regards.
Barrister Edward Ikechi

subject: Re: More understanding
body:
Hello Barrister Edward Ikechi,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this information with me. It's quite an interesting situation, isn't it? I'm sorry to hear about the passing of Mr. Steve Moore. He must have been a very successful man to have saved such a large amount of money.

I'm curious, how did you come across my contact information? And why do you believe I would be the best person to help in this situation?

Also, could you please explain more about what being the 'next of kin' entails? What responsibilities would I have in this role?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Keith
